alert.note: Alert for Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 4:39PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 630 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Cruz, Scotts Valley, Felton, Ben Lomond, Boulder Creek, Eureka Canyon Road, Lexington Hills and Day Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
